**APN Consulting Services for Underground Electrical Distribution Network Replacement**
=====================================

**Solicitation Summary**
-----------------------

The Department of Defence Construction Canada - Quebec Region is soliciting advance procurement notice (APN) for consulting services to replace the underground electrical distribution network at the St-Jean Garrison in Quebec.

**Project Description**
---------------------

This project involves replacing the main electrical input and various components of the existing underground electrical distribution network, constructing new infrastructure to meet requirements, and servicing electrical inputs in some existing buildings. Professional services may include, but are not limited to, design services in electrical and high-voltage distribution, civil and structural engineering, building services, architecture, and services during construction.

**Contract Award and Security Requirements**
-----------------------------------------

Consultants seeking contract award must actively hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of closing. The required security clearance is a VALIDATED DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (VOD) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

**Industrial Security Program (ISP) Sponsorship**
---------------------------------------------

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) offers early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Consultants interested in participating but lacking the required security clearance must apply to DCC's ISP. Guidance on the sponsorship process and timelines is available on DCC's website: https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements.

**Process Timeline and Timeline**
-------------------------------

The sponsorship request package must be completed 30 days before the planned solicitation closing date for DSP and 60 days for FSC.

**Important Notice**
-------------------

By applying to the sponsorship process, consultants accept all associated risks. There is no guarantee that a security clearance application will be successful or processed in a timely manner.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For questions regarding the sponsorship process or this procurement notice, please contact:

Jean Bergeron
Coordinator, Professional Services Contracts
Defence Construction Canada
418-932-7092
Jean.Bergeron@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

You may submit an offer and access documents through http://www.merx.com. Please consult the fees applicable.
